text:
Thanks to all who responded with help! FYI, the troubleshooter worked for me
(although I had already manually removed HP Smart from this system with Win10
Pro 22H2 that had no HP devices). It cleaned up the printer names. It's
interesting that the cleanup takes a "long" time----I am curious why but glad
that it works. Printing was messed up functionally on this machine until I got
rid of HP Smart. Jobs were going to the wrong queue even though the default
printer was properly tagged as such. Anyone know if the troubleshooter will
PREVENT a future bogus download of HP Smart? Happy Holidays to all! Ira Ira
Shapiro Computer Consulting

metadata.topic: RE: Printer names and icons might be changed and HP Smart...
metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] RE: Printer names and icons might be changed and HP Smart...
metadata.email_text_original:
Thanks to all who responded with help! FYI, the troubleshooter worked for me
(although I had already manually removed HP Smart from this system with Win10
Pro 22H2 that had no HP devices). It cleaned up the printer names. It's
interesting that the cleanup takes a "long" time----I am curious why but glad
that it works. Printing was messed up functionally on this machine until I got
rid of HP Smart. Jobs were going to the wrong queue even though the default
printer was properly tagged as such. Anyone know if the troubleshooter will
PREVENT a future bogus download of HP Smart? Happy Holidays to all! Ira Ira
Shapiro Computer Consulting -----Original Message----- From:
patchmanagement@googlegroups.com [mailto:patchmanagement@googlegroups.com] On
Behalf Of Howard A. Goldberg Sent: Friday, December 22, 2023 6:38 AM To:
patchmanagement@googlegroups.com Subject: RE: [patchmanagement] RE: Printer
names and icons might be changed and HP Smart... I ran the troubleshooter on two
W10 Pro systems by right clicking on the file and selecting 'run as
administrator.' Issue was resolved on both systems (although it took about 30-40
minutes for the icons to flip back to the original state). That said, I did not
have issues printing - the issue seemed to be cosmetic on my systems. Howard A.
Goldberg Social Media Strategist/MERCAZ USA -----Original Message----- From:
patchmanagement@googlegroups.com On Behalf Of Shawn K. Hall Sent: Friday,
December 22, 2023 00:19 To: patchmanagement@googlegroups.com Subject: RE:
[patchmanagement] RE: Printer names and icons might be changed and HP Smart...
Theoretically:
https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fdownload%2Fdetails.aspx%3Fid%3D105763&data=05%7C02%7Cemail_ingestion%40bighatgroup.com%7C1d1e2eeb28784067c81e08dc03f5e479%7C5a01497e1bcb4711b6e6d24f4ab00393%7C0%7C0%7C638389601837263305%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=HV9ccAqHFCnQeEljhyheEsgZfYtuQpP6DBKEitD864s%3D&reserved=0
There hasn't been much discussion on whether it actually works, yet -- check the
thread "HP Smart/Printer Metadata Troubleshooter". -S
Link: None
